text: Julia Language server uses a lot of internet data... Is this normal?

elements.text: Julia Language server uses a lot of internet data... Is this normal?

text: I think at the moment it is not downloading anything at all. Why do you think it is using internet data, and how did you measure that?

elements.text: I think at the moment it is not downloading anything at all. Why do you think it is using internet data, and how did you measure that?

text: We _are_ uploading crash reports, but those shouldn't take a lot of data unless you're crashing constantly. You can also opt out of those

elements.text: uploading crash reports, but those shouldn't take a lot of data unless you're crashing constantly. You can also opt out of those

text: True, but if you check which process is doing the uploading, it should also not be the LS.

elements.text: True, but if you check which process is doing the uploading, it should also not be the LS.

text:
It stopped doing that since I removed Metalhead
It was constantly stuck on Indexing Metalhead and took up almost a GB of internet data before I closed my VSCode
Ultimately, I removed Metalhead and the indexing moved ahead smoothly
Note that I'm on 1.6beta...
Something similar happened to me while using kakoune too

elements.text:
It stopped doing that since I removed Metalhead

text: Ah, ok, so this was just indexing, but no internet data involved, right? That makes sense, indexing can take a long time and can get stuck. We're working on something better :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Ah, ok, so this was just indexing, but no internet data involved, right? That makes sense, indexing can take a long time and can get stuck. We're working on something better

text:
Ohhh？Looks like I can look forward to something better:smile:
Any big changes coming to LanguageServer.jl？

elements.text: Ohhh？Looks like I can look forward to something better
Any big changes coming to LanguageServer.jl？

text: We're trying to reduce the need for indexing on user machines a lot. Won't happen overnight, though :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: We're trying to reduce the need for indexing on user machines a lot. Won't happen overnight, though
